title: Pathway Resource Guide
text:
This is a resource guide for advisors, faculty mentors, and students within the Arts, Humanities, and Communications Pathway at Lower Columbia College.
For more resources, please see the General Transfer Resource Guide or explore LCC’s other Career Pathways.


The following chapters include an annotated collection of links to program and degree offerings that align with the programs/degrees at LCC. Each chapter provides resources for a specific, common transfer institution for LCC students.



Please send questions, feedback, and content requests to Trey Batey. Alternatively, this could be a link to an online form.

title: 1  Central Washington University
text:
LCC’s Arts, Humanities, and Communication Pathway programs and degree options align with the departments, programs, and degrees found within Central Washington University’s College of Arts and Humanities.
List the programs/degrees that most closely align with LCC’s programs/degrees.

title: 1  Central Washington University
text:
1.2 Communication Studies
CWU’s Department of Communication offers majors in Communications (B.A.), Media and Journalism (B.A.), and Public Relations (B.A.). This department also offers several minors and multiple certificates.

title: 2  Eastern Washington University
text:
LCC’s Arts, Humanities, and Communication Pathway programs and degree options align with the departments, programs, and degrees found within Eastern Washington University’s College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
List the programs/degrees that most closely align with LCC’s programs/degrees.

title: 2  Eastern Washington University
text:
2.1 Art and Design
The Fine and Performing Arts Department offers an Art Program that includes seven degree options (listed below).

title: 2  Eastern Washington University
text:
2.2 Communication Studies
EWU’s Department of Communication Studies offers two bachelor’s degrees, a minor, a certificate (Leadership), and a master’s degree (Organizational Leadership).
